channel.title: Opinions Needed
channel.description:
Starting about 2 weeks ago I have started getting flooded with people on MSN about me programming their RSPS stuff for them, so I have some up with an idea. A web-hosted server, that is ran via exe on your computer. I know, it would limit it down to Windows only, but I would add more runners for Linux and Mac later.
Features: [ul][li]Multiple servers [all 317] (Delta, BlazeScape, Battlescape) more later....[/li] [li]Bans, Mutes, and such loaded VIA C:/rs-server/*ServerType*/config/[/li] [li]All strings loading from 2-3 text files via C:/rs-server/*ServerType*/strings/[/li] [li]Force-Owner/Admin for all development users, with a pre-programmed password that is not saved in the character file.[/li] [li]Compatable IP-Changer client downloads[/li][/ul]
I just want to get the idea, this would need a dev team. I just want to know, would it be worth the trouble? To get some respect around here? Well, I already have some respect, from some people, but yea.
Known helpers: (if decided to do) [ul][li]CoonHunter - Lead Developer[/li] [li](Coon's friend on MSN) - Lead Web-Dev.[/li][/ul]
For those who dont understand, this will clear some parts up: [quote="CoonHunter"]What i am trying to do, is make a server, that anybody can run a copy of. It will be hosted online, but, be ran on a downloadable file. The strings and stuff will be loaded from a file in your C drive. Including server-name and everything.
Each server will have a client that will ONLY work with that server as well, meaning a custom client version.[/quote]
I am working on a concept server right now, to better explain what im talking about.

item.title: Opinions Needed
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Newty:

You said that you were going to have trouble loading strings from files? That really makes me worry about the overall progress of this project…

The trouble is not really loading the strings themselves, but such a high number of strings. My trouble will be sorting things out, so they are easily found, not loading.

Read full topic

item.title: Opinions Needed
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

You said that you were going to have trouble loading strings from files? That really makes me worry about the overall progress of this project…

Read full topic

item.title: Opinions Needed
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“Scape-JAVA, post:33, topic:339137”][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=435522.msg3199568#msg3199568 date=1273187314]

Sounds like a splendid idea, i’m sure if you actually follow through with this idea it will help many new programmers get familiar with the java language.

Remember, this is a web-hosted Jarred server, so there is nothing to do with users getting .java files.
[/quote]

Edit:
I’ve taken the time to re-read this and it doesn’t sound like the best idea.[/quote]
Also, about me following through with it, I will at least get it mostly done if I stop. If I do stop, its because I finally got a job, or college fall semester begins.

Jc22493:

I like the idea, but identical sources?

I plan on using about 5 different servers myself. As the Deltascape one is finished, now that I have cleaned it to hell, I will start on another. As it grows, I will add in a “premium” feature for servers, and buy a real domain.

Read full topic

item.title: Opinions Needed
item.dc:creator: @the_soul The Soul
item.description:
@the_soul wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:30, topic:339137”][quote author=HitThisCity link=topic=435522.msg3199527#msg3199527 date=1273185077]
Did you name your username sounds so racist :eek:?
[/quote]
How? Coon = Short for Raccoon

Also, CoonHunter sounds better than RaccoonHunter[/quote]

A synonym to coon however is ‘nigger’.

@idea: I don’t know…it doesn’t lead me on to me thinking this of a potential idea, but I guess all I can do is wish you luck.

Read full topic

item.title: Opinions Needed
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

ziplock:

This will be open source right?

A Jar file can be turned into open-source, and I wont be obfuscating it. So far, I am still getting the Strings from textHandler and Client.java to load from a txt file, when I get textHandler 100% loading, and Client.java at least 10%, I will release a beta version of it.

Read full topic

item.title: Opinions Needed
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

Good luck in this. One problem I’d point out though would be the issue of having the exact same server. This is one of the major downsides to it in my opinion.

Read full topic

item.title: Opinions Needed
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Thanks, i’m going to need it. Turning nearly every string inside of the server, to be loaded from a txt file will take some time, but I am trying my best.

@Cocoa - This will be able to be played via localhost? Its just a Jar that is hosted online, but ran in a batch file that was converted to a executable. Its the same effect, just people wont need to scramble through all of the files, and not know what to do. They will simply ask for features, and I will add them as people vote. Yes, its going to fill the server-status with more of the same servers, but it will at least get people some idea of what it takes just to run the server, even without programming it.

Read full topic

item.title: Opinions Needed

item.description:
@cocoa wrote:

Sounds dumb and will just fill up the server status with more of the exact same server. If someone wants a server just so they can be an admin, they should just play on localhost.
